newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SOCCER-SINGAPORE PLAYER PARALYSED AFTER FALL.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-SINGAPORE PLAYER PARALYSED AFTER FALL.

text.p: Former Singapore international Anthony Samy has been paralysed from the neck down after falling awkwardly during a soccer match, the New paper reported on Wednesday.
The evening newspaper said the 31-year-old, who played for Singapore from 1986-87, collided with another player during a friendly between Woodlands Wellington and Selangor.
He was taken to hospital, where doctors said damage to his spinal column had left him permanently paralysed.
